item.title: Honkai: Star Rail 8BitDo Ultimate 2 Controller Unveiled, Preorders Open Today
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

8BitDo has revealed an officially licensed controller themed around the popular free-to-play RPG Honkai: Star Rail. Just like the recently released Wuchang: Fallen Feathers collaboration, the Honkai: Star Rail model is an Ultimate 2 Wireless Controller for PC, Apple devices, and Android. The design revolves around Evernight, the mysterious upcoming playable character that's set to join Honkai: Star Rail soon.

The Honkai: Star Rail: Evernight 8BitDo Ultimate 2 is available to preorder starting today for $70, which is 10 bucks more than the price of the regular editions (and five bucks more than the Wuchang model). The controller is slated to release this fall; Amazon currently lists the launch date as October 16.

8BitDo is also releasing a Collector's Bundle that comes with four stick caps, a themed, hardshell carrying case, temporary tattoo stickers, and a glittery coaster featuring Evernight.

8BitDo Ultimate 2 Wireless Controller - Honkai: Star Rail Edition

$70

The 8BitDo Ultimate 2 has an impressive list of features, especially when you consider the price. It's equipped with TMR electromagnetic joysticks, which are even more precise and durable than Hall Effect sticks. You'll find two remappable buttons on the back and two extra shoulder buttons. Switches on the back change the triggers from conventional Hall Effect linear triggers to rapid-fire microswitch buttons. The Ultimate 2 also has RGB lighting rings, dual rumble motors, motion controls, and more pro-style features. With 8BitDo's Ultimate Software V2, you can create and save up to three custom profiles as well as adjust settings like stick sensitivity.

The Ultimate 2 comes with a matching charging dock, which has a compartment to store the 2.4GHz adapter. This isn't the Bluetooth model, so it won't work on Nintendo Switch 1/2, but the 2.4GHz model also has Bluetooth support for Android, Apple devices, and SteamOS.

Key Features

  • 2.4GHz Wireless on PC (USB-C dongle)
  • Bluetooth on Apple, Android, SteamOS
  • Wired on PC
  • TMR electromagnetic joysticks
  • Change trigger type by flipping switches:
    • Hall Effect Triggers
    • Non-linear Microswitch Triggers
  • 2 remappable back triggers
  • 2 extra remappable shoulder buttons
  • Profile button: Stores 3 custom layouts
  • Turbo button
  • Tactile bumpers
  • Tactile D-pad
  • Textured grips
  • RGB lighting rings
  • 1,000Hz polling rate for 2.4GHz and wired
  • 6-axis motion controls
  • Dual rumble motors
  • 1,000mAh battery
  • Colors: White, Black, Purple, Green, Wuchang Edition
  • Special Editions: Honkai: Star Rail / Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
  • Includes matching USB-C charging dock

Customize with 8BitDo Ultimate Software V2

  • Remap inputs
  • Set up three custom profiles
  • Set up dead zones
  • Adjust motion control sensitivity
  • Adjust stick sensitivity
  • Adjust trigger sensitivity
  • Adjust rumble intensity
  • Adjust lighting effects

Check out our review and deals roundup for the 8BitDo Ultimate 2 and Ultimate 2 Bluetooth for more details on why this controller is such a solid choice.

Other 8BitDo Controller Collaborations

8BitDo has collaborated with multiple publishers in recent months to create stylish special-edition controllers. Along with the new Honkai: Star Rail and Wuchang Ultimate 2 Controllers, 8BitDo recently partnered with Microsoft to celebrate Rare's 40th anniversary. The 8BitDo 3-Mode: Rare 40th Anniversary Edition is the manufacturer's first wireless Xbox controller. Last year, 8BitDo launched a pair of budget-friendly Black Myth: Wukong Ultimate 2C Controllers. There's also a Genshin Impact-themed version of 8BitDo's original Ultimate Controller for PC and mobile.

  • 8BitDo Ultimate 2 Wireless - Wuchang: Fallen Feathers -- $58.50 ($65)
  • 8BitDo Ultimate 3-Mode Wireless - Rare 40th Anniversary -- $90
  • 8BitDo Ultimate 2C Wireless - Black Myth: Wukong -- $30 ($35)
  • 8BitDo Ultimate 2C Wired - Black Myth: Wukong -- $17.49 ($25)
  • 8BitDo Ultimate Wireless - Genshin Impact -- $60

Hoyoverse Honkai: Star Rail Firefly Controllers

Honkai: Star Rail fans have another high-end controller option for PC. The Hoyoverse Firefly Elite Controller has a bunch of pro-style features, too. Unfortunately, the controller on its own isn't available, but there is a bundle with a charging dock and carrying case for $186. Yes, that's very expensive.

  • Hoyoverse Honkai: Star Rail Firefly Elite Controller Bundle -- $186
  • Hoyoverse Honkai: Star Rail Firefly Elite Controller -- Sold out

Honkai: Star Rail fans can also get a pair of Moondrop noise-canceling wireless earbuds modeled after the earbuds Robin wears in the game. These are quite popular on Amazon and are on sale for $100 (was $120).

  • Moondrop Honkai: Star Rail ANC Wireless Earbuds -- $100 ($120)

item.title: Battlefield 6 Battle Royale Gameplay Footage Leaks
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Battlefield Studios has kicked off testing for the Battlefield 6 battle royale mode for Battlefield Labs testers, and while people in the test are forbidden from publishing their footage, that's exactly what has happened. Footage has emerged online, showing off a good look at the map, vehicles, and combat.

People are reacting positively to the leak, but it remains to be seen if Electronic Arts will attempt to scrub the footage from the internet. A second video reveals the drop-in sequence in the battle royale mode. You can see the footage for yourself in the videos below (via Insider Gaming).

Earlier this week, Battlefield Studios opened the floodgates on the battle royale mode for Battlefield 6 in terms of information and specifics. The game will support 100-player matches and it will feature Battlefield's trademark destruction elements. The developers also said the battle royale mode will have the deadliest ring in the entire battle royale genre--if you simply touch it, you're dead.

You can sign up for Battlefield Labs for a chance to try the battle royale mode ahead of launch.

Battlefield 6 launches on October 10 for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. There is no word yet when the battle royale mode could be released, or if it's a premium game that's part of Battlefield or a standalone download.
